Class Square

java.lang.Object
elements.Square
public class Square extends Object
Represents a single square on the chessboard. A square contains information about its color, rank, file, whether it is empty, and the piece occupying it (if any).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Square()
    Constructs a new Square, initially empty with no piece placed on it.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Square
    copy()
    Creates a copy of the current square, including all its properties and piece (if any).
    Game.Color
    getColor()
    Returns the color of the square.
    char
    getFile()
    Returns the file (column) of the square.
    boolean
    getIsEmpty()
    Returns whether the square is empty (i.e., contains no piece).
    Piece
    getPiece()
    Returns the piece occupying the square, if any.
    int
    getRank()
    Returns the rank (row) of the square.
    void
    setColor(Game.Color color)
    Sets the color of the square.
    void
    setFile(char file)
    Sets the file (column) of the square.
    void
    setIsEmpty(boolean empty)
    Sets whether the square is empty or not.
    void
    setPiece(Piece piece)
    Sets the piece occupying the square.
    void
    setRank(int rank)
    Sets the rank (row) of the square.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a string representation of the square's position using its file and rank (e.g., "a1", "h8").

    • getIsEmpty

      public boolean getIsEmpty()
      Returns whether the square is empty (i.e., contains no piece).
      Returns:
      True if the square is empty, false otherwise.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece()
      Returns the piece occupying the square, if any.
      Returns:
      The piece on the square, or null if the square is empty.

      public void setFile(char file)

      Parameters:
      file - The file of the square.

    • setIsEmpty

      public void setIsEmpty(boolean empty)
      Sets whether the square is empty or not.
      Parameters:
      empty - True if the square is empty, false otherwise.

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Piece piece)
      Sets the piece occupying the square.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to place on the square, or null to leave it empty.

    • copy

      public Square copy()
      Creates a copy of the current square, including all its properties and piece (if any).
      Returns:
      A new Square object that is a copy of the current square.
